problem_statement: Refactor a monolithic, synchronous order processing function into a decoupled, service-oriented architecture. The legacy implementation violates the Single Responsibility Principle by mixing payment validation, inventory management, and tax calculation into a single high-risk transaction block.
PASS_TO_PASS: tests/refactored.test.js should process a valid order successfully
tests/refactored.test.js should return same data shape as legacy processor
tests/refactored.test.js should fail when order has no items
tests/refactored.test.js should fail when item is out of stock
tests/refactored.test.js should fail when payment is declined
tests/refactored.test.js TaxService should be independently testable
tests/refactored.test.js InventoryService should be independently testable
tests/refactored.test.js PaymentService should be independently testable
tests/refactored.test.js should have specific error classes
tests/isolation.test.js Requirement 7: Payment failure should NOT call inventory reservation
tests/isolation.test.js Requirement 4: Inventory should only be reserved after successful payment
tests/isolation.test.js Should execute pipeline steps in correct order
tests/tax.test.js Requirement 8: California order should use 9.25% tax rate
tests/tax.test.js Texas order should use 8.25% tax rate
tests/tax.test.js Unknown state should use default 8.25% rate
tests/tax.test.js No state provided should use default rate
tests/tax.test.js Should calculate correct total for California order
tests/tax.test.js Should calculate correct total for Texas order
tests/tax.test.js Should support dynamic tax rate configuration
